meanings.definition: A thin strip of leather or other material used for binding or edging.

meanings.sent2: The bookbinder added a decorative rand to the spine of the journal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the rand, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The rand of gold on the book's cover gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To range or wander around aimlessly.

meanings.sent2: After finishing his work, he liked to rand through the park to clear his mind.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to rand around the playground in search of hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to rand from one topic to another, never staying focused.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in South Africa.
meanings.sent1: He exchanged his dollars for rands before his trip to Johannesburg.
meanings.sent2: The price of the souvenir was displayed in both dollars and rands.
meanings.sent3: She saved up all her rands to buy a special gift for her grandmother.
meanings.sent4: The street vendor happily accepted the payment in rands for the handmade crafts.
meanings.sent5: The traveler marveled at the colorful banknotes of the South African rand.
